intro: Anchusa dasyantha, commonly known as the woolly blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage and spikes of blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant belongs to the Boraginaceae family, which is known for its often hairy stems and showy flowers. Anchusa dasyantha typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in disturbed areas. It is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 1 meter, making it a distinctive feature in its native habitats.
